fields.description: Occurs when the immune system overreacts to a harmless substance called an allergen
fields.name: Allergic reaction

fields.description: An infection occurring in a patient in a hospital or other radiation treatment centre in whom the infection was not present or incubating at the time of admission
fields.name: Infection

fields.description: Harm that arose as a result of a procedure ancillary to the patients’ radiation therapy course of treatment. i.e. catheter insertion, intravenous contrast etc.
fields.name: Interventional procedure error

fields.description: Harm or damage; an act or event that causes someone or something to no longer be fully healthy or in good condition
fields.name: Fall or other accident

fields.description:
A malfunction in either hardware and or software impacting the accurate delivery of a
treatment plan or resulting in a patient injury
fields.name: Hardware/Software

fields.description: Incorrect execution of the prescribed dose or fractionation
fields.name: Wrong prescription dose

fields.description: The incorrect execution of the treatment plan
fields.name: Wrong plan dose

fields.description: The incorrect computation of patients plan dose, dose volume histograms (DVH), manual calculations, etc.
fields.name: Calculation error

fields.description: The incorrect measurement of machine characteristics at the time of commissioning or servicing affecting output or other parameters necessary for accurate treatment delivery
fields.name: Calibration error

fields.description: The involvement of an incorrect patient
fields.name: Wrong patient

fields.description: The involvement of a site other than that identified in the prescription
fields.name: Wrong anatomical site

fields.description: The involvement of the contralateral side opposite to that identified in the prescription
fields.name: Wrong side (laterality)

fields.description: Patient positioning that is contraindicated to the setup used at the time of simulation for example; feet first vs head first
fields.name: Wrong patient position

fields.description: A shift that is incorrect in magnitude and or direction from the shift determined in the plan
fields.name: Wrong shift from setup point

fields.description: Contours, and associated margins that are contraindicated to planning guidelines and or standards of practice
fields.name: Wrong target or OAR contours, or wrong planning margins

fields.description: Patient motion that is in excess to the accepted established tolerances
fields.name: Patient movement during simulation or treatment

fields.description: The application of incorrect accessories for treatment (for example incorrect immobilization device, omission of bolus, incorrect shielding or electron cutout)
fields.name: Wrong treatment accessories
